intro: Xyris bracteicaulis, commonly known as the bract-leaved yellow-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the genus Xyris, which is part of the grass family Poaceae. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Xyris bracteicaulis typically grows in wetlands and marshy areas, preferring moist, acidic soils. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems and a subject of study in botanical research.
